span.span: Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the bounds of this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是，它使用直接事件处理路由策略。 is a that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由的事件不会引发在路由过程;相反，它们被处理的同一元素中引发位置。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们启用了路由的事件的行为，如在样式中的事件触发的其他方面。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管跟踪何时鼠标离开某个元素，此事件的详细信息按原义报告属性值已从`true`到`false`此元素上。Although tracks when the mouse leaves an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `true` to `false` on this element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这看上去要遵循元素树的浮升路由，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this seems to follow a bubbling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . > [!IMPORTANT] > 某些控件类可能具有固有的类的鼠标按钮事件处理。Some control classes might have inherent class handling for mouse button events. 鼠标左键按下事件是最有可能的事件，以便使类处理在控件中。The left mouse button down event is the most likely event to have class handling in a control. 类通常处理标记基础为已处理的类事件。The class handling often marks the underlying class event as handled. 一旦该事件标记为已处理，其他实例处理程序附加到该元素通常不会引发。Once the event is marked handled, other instance handlers that are attached to that element are not ordinarily raised. 通常也不会引发的任何其他类或实例处理程序附加到针对 UI 树的根节点的浮升方向中的元素。Any other class or instance handlers that are attached to elements in the bubbling direction towards the root in the UI tree are also not ordinarily raised. 您可以解决的问题，在前面的重要说明中所述和仍接收鼠标左键按下具有类处理通过使用这些解决方案的派生类上的事件的事件：You can resolve the issue that is outlined in the preceding Important and still receive events for left mouse button down events on a derived class that has class handling by using either of these solutions: - 附加处理程序未标记为已由控件处理的事件。Attach handlers for the event, which is not marked as handled by the controls. 请注意，由于这是预览事件，该路由从根开始，隧道下行控件。Notice that because this is a preview event, the route starts at the root and tunnels down to the control. - 虽然通过调用注册该控件上的处理程序，然后选择使处理程序以侦听事件，即使它们已标记为已处理路由的事件数据中的签名选项。Register a handler on the control procedurally by calling and choosing the signature option that enables handlers to listen for events even if they are already marked as handled in the routed event data. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且移动鼠标指针时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 标识 路由事件。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event MouseRightButtonDown As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标右键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这看上去要遵循元素树的浮升路由，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this seems to follow a bubbling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . 右侧的按钮的鼠标事件中经常会有本机处理应用程序方案。Right button mouse events frequently have native handling in application scenarios. 例如，鼠标左键按下的可能会显示上下文菜单。For instance, a right mouse button down might display a context menu. 请参阅[ContextMenu 概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/contextmenu-overview.md)。See [ContextMenu Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/contextmenu-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.RoutedEvent MouseRightButtonDownEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly MouseRightButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于在鼠标指针位于其中;因此，如果你收到从已设定焦点或捕获的元素的事件，鼠标指针可能实际上是另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive the event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: A traversal request, which contains a property that indicates either a mode to traverse in existing tab order, or a direction to move visually.

summary.span: 尝试将焦点从此元素移到其他元素。

span.span: Attempts to move focus from this element to another element.

summary.span: 移动焦点的方向由指导方向指定，该方向在此元素的可视父级的组织结构中解释。

span.span: The direction to move focus is specified by a guidance direction, which is interpreted within the organization of the visual parent for this element.

returns.span: 如果执行了请求的遍历，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the requested traversal was performed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请务必检查此方法的返回值。Make sure you check the return value of this method. 返回值为`false`如果遍历遇到控件的组合所定义的制表位并且遍历请求未请求来包装可能会返回。A return value of `false` might be returned if the traversal runs into a tab stop that is defined by a control's composition, and the traversal request did not request to wrap.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnAccessKey(class System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs e) cil managed

abstract member OnAccessKey : System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs -> unit override this.OnAccessKey : System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs -> unit

param.name: e
param.span: 访问键事件的事件数据。

span.span: The event data to the access key event.

param.span: 事件数据报告哪个键被调用，并指示控制发送这些事件的 对象是否也将此访问键调用发送到其他元素。

span.span: The event data reports which key was invoked, and indicate whether the object that controls the sending of these events also sent this access key invocation to other elements.

summary.span: 在调用对于此元素有意义的访问键时提供类处理。

span.span: Provides class handling for when an access key that is meaningful for this element is invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在没有实际 AccessKey 事件类，或其他位置，你可以引发或附加处理程序。There is no actual AccessKey event in the class, or elsewhere, which you can raise or attach handlers for. 相反，事件是通过专用管理器类， ，其中进行后续处理所有输入要搜索适用于整个输入模型的访问密钥。Instead, the event is originated via a dedicated manager class, , which post-processes all input to search for access keys that are applicable to the entire input model.

para.span: 在此方法的默认实现设置键盘焦点设定到此元素 (通过调用)。

span.span: The default implementation of this method in sets keyboard focus to this element (by calling ).

para.span: 实现应保持此行为，它们是否可获得焦点，因为它是可访问性方案的预期的行为。

span.span: Implementations should perpetuate this behavior if they are focusable, because it is an expected behavior for accessibility scenarios.

para.span: 请注意，不执行任何操作传递的事件数据的基实现，并且不引发其他事件;它只需设置焦点。

span.span: Note that the base implementation does nothing with the passed event data and raises no further event; it just sets the focus.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnChildDesiredSizeChanged(class System.Windows.UIElement child) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnChildDesiredSizeChanged (child As UIElement)
abstract member OnChildDesiredSizeChanged : System.Windows.UIElement -> unit override this.OnChildDesiredSizeChanged : System.Windows.UIElement -> unit

param.name: child
param.span: 重新调整其大小的子元素。

span.span: The child element that is being resized.

summary.span: 重新调整子元素的大小时支持布局行为。

span.span: Supports layout behavior when a child element is resized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序代码通常不调用此方法。This method is typically not called by your application code. 它公开使类可以进行进一步的派生的元素检查自己可能是无效的布局的状态。It is exposed so that derived element classes can make further checks on their own possibly invalid layout state. 类还可以尝试优化，以最大程度减少基于子元素的大小更改布局处理过程的处理时间。Classes could also attempt optimizations to minimize the processing time for a layout pass based on size changes to child elements. 示例派生实现的元素类是控件。An example derived element class that implements is the control.

para.span: 方法已调用的默认实现本身上。

span.span: The method has the default implementation of calling on itself.

para.span: 典型的实现方法是： 执行您自己的元素的任何优化支持，，然后通常调用基从至少其中一个代码分支 （指示每个度量值缓存逻辑的"更新"状态的一个）。

span.span: A typical implementation would be: do whatever optimization your own element supports, and then typically call base from at least one of the code branches (the one that indicated "dirty" state per your own measure caching logic).

para.span: 仅在布局处理子元素自身产生的大小更改时调用此方法。

span.span: This method is only called in the layout processing if it was the child itself that originated the size changes.

para.span: 否则为如果启动了父元素传递，布局系统规则，根据父在重新计算布局。

span.span: Otherwise, if the parent element initiates the pass, according to the layout system rules, the parent is recalculating layout already.

para.span: 布局系统处理顺序子级到父级的布局，因此从子元素布局调用没有返回到父元素调整大小是必需的。

span.span: The layout system processes layout in the order of child-to-parent, so no return to parent element sizing from the child element layout calls is necessary.

summary.span: 为 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] 基础结构返回特定于类的 实现。

span.span: Returns class-specific implementations for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.

span.span: The type-specific implementation.

para.span: 此方法的实现通常是调用特定构造函数实现中，并将其返回作为返回值。

span.span: The implementation of this method is typically to call the constructor of a specific implementation, and return it as the return value.

para.span: 所有派生的类应实现此方法以提供其各自的特定实现到[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]基础结构。

span.span: All derived classes should implement this method in order to provide their own specific implementations to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.

para.span: 有关实现此模式的详细信息，请参阅。

span.span: For details on implementing this pattern, see .

abstract member OnDragEnter : System.Windows.DragEventArgs -> unit override this.OnDragEnter : System.Windows.DragEventArgs -> unit

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

Protected Overridable Sub OnDragLeave (e As DragEventArgs)

summary.span: 使用所提供的事件数据引发 路由事件。

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。The implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event.

para.span: 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。

span.span: Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation.

para.span: 否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。

span.span: Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element.

para.span: 如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到。

span.span: If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to .

span.span: Provides class handling for the routed event that occurs when a touch is captured to this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有默认实现。The method has no default implementation. 重写中派生的类来处理事件。Override in a derived class to handle the event. 请务必调用基类的方法，从而基本类接收事件。Be sure to call the base class' method so that base classes receive the event.

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当针对此元素引发未处理的 事件时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled event is raised on this element.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此虚方法引发时的值依赖关系属性更改。This virtual method is raised when the value of the dependency property changes. 虚拟方法首先引发，并可以处理在必要时的事件数据。The virtual method is raised first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. 然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. 请注意，事件不是路由的事件。Notice that the event is not a routed event. 因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此虚方法引发时的值依赖关系属性更改。This virtual method is raised when the value of the dependency property changes . 虚拟方法首先引发，并可以处理在必要时的事件数据。The virtual method is raised first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. 然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. 请注意，事件不是路由的事件。Notice that the event is not a routed event. 因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements.

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 击键通过专用的输入管理器进行处理。Keystrokes are handled by a dedicated input manager. 其他编程功能，依赖于击键，例如，输入和命令绑定，可能会在键击公开为常规击键之前处理。Other programming features that rely on keystrokes, for example, input and command bindings, might handle the keystroke before it is exposed as a general keystroke. 如果这些输入系统功能将事件标记为已处理，然后不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, then is not invoked. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

span.span: A that contains event data.

summary.span: 使用提供的事件数据引发 路由事件。

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data that is provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 此实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。This implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event.

para.span: 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。

span.span: Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation.

para.span: 否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。

span.span: Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element.

para.span: 如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到。

span.span: If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件，具有直接的路由策略。In this case the matching event is a routed event, with a direct routing strategy. 将事件标记为已处理是仍有助于防止典型实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing the typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 看起来进行浮升路由事件，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是基础事件是冒泡路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 看起来进行浮升路由事件，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是基础事件是冒泡路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写但是，而无需调用基实现; 在派生类中此替代禁用上下文菜单上的服务控件，都是一部分的默认行为。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling base; however, this override disables the context menu services on your control, which are part of the default behavior.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着类处理负责操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加路由事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写但是，而无需调用基实现; 在派生类中此替代禁用上下文菜单上的服务控件，都是一部分的默认行为。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling base; however, this override disables the context menu services on your control, which are part of the default behavior.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着类处理负责操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

abstract member OnPreviewStylusInAirMove : System.Windows.Input.StylusEventArgs -> unit override this.OnPreviewStylusInAirMove : System.Windows.Input.StylusEventArgs -> unit

span.span: Provides class handling for the routed event that occurs when a touch presses this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有默认实现。The method has no default implementation. 重写中派生的类来处理事件。Override in a derived class to handle the event. 请务必调用基类的方法，从而基本类接收事件。Be sure to call the base class' method so that base classes receive the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

param.name: drawingContext

span.span: The drawing instructions for a specific element.

param.span: 此上下文是为布局系统提供的。

span.span: This context is provided to the layout system.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，会参与由布局系统控制的呈现操作。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system.

summary.span: 调用此方法时，不直接使用此元素的呈现指令，而是将其保留供布局和绘制在以后异步使用。

span.span: The rendering instructions for this element are not used directly when this method is invoked, and are instead preserved for later asynchronous use by layout and drawing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法中具有默认实现类。This method has no default implementation in the class. ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示了面板派生类的一个可能实现。The following code example shows a possible implementation for a panel derived class. [!code-csharp[LightWeightCustomPanel#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/LightWeightCustomPanel/CSharp/OffsetPanel.cs#1)] [!code-vb[LightWeightCustomPanel#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/LightWeightCustomPanel/visualbasic/offsetpanel.vb#1)]

para.span: 方法可以重写以添加更多 （以前没有在逻辑树中定义） 的图形元素到呈现的元素，例如效果或装饰器。

span.span: The method can be overridden to add further graphical elements (not previously defined in a logical tree) to a rendered element, such as effects or adorners.

para.span: 一个对象作为参数，它提供用于绘制形状、 文本、 图像或视频的方法传递。

span.span: A object is passed as an argument, which provides methods for drawing shapes, text, images or videos.

param.name: info
param.span: 打包的参数 ()，其中包括新旧大小，其尺寸实际上发生了改变。

span.span: The packaged parameters (), which includes old and new sizes, and which dimension actually changes.

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，会参与由布局系统控制的呈现操作。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system.

summary.span: 如果元素的 已因布局更新而更改，则在布局更新之后以及呈现之前调用此方法。

span.span: This method is invoked after layout update, and before rendering, if the element's has changed as a result of layout update.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 典型的 WPF 框架级元素使用的重写实现从。A typical WPF framework-level element uses the override implementation from . 实现使失效和属性和句柄更新布局的基础知识。The implementation invalidates the and properties and handles the basics of remaking the layout. 重写在级别意味着元素实现特意不使用 WPF 框架级别的实现，并因此您的元素必须处理的布局逻辑更直接，通常通过编写替换布局系统。Overriding at the level implies that your element implementation is deliberately not using the WPF framework-level implementation, and therefore your element must handle layout logic more directly, typically by writing a replacement layout system.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. 将事件标记为已处理是仍有助于防止典型实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked.

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double Opacity { double get(); void set(double value); };
member this.Opacity : double with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)

summary.span: 获取或设置当 在 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] 中呈现时为其整体应用的不透明度因子。

span.span: Gets or sets the opacity factor applied to the entire when it is rendered in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].

summary.span: 这是依赖项属性。

span.span: This is a dependency property.

value.span: 不透明度因子。

span.span: The opacity factor.

value.span: 默认不透明度为 1.0。

span.span: Default opacity is 1.0.

value.span: 值应介于 0.0 和 1.0 之间。

span.span: Expected values are between 0.0 and 1.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 1.0 的默认值是通过此依赖属性的初始元数据提供默认类。The 1.0 default value is the default provided by the initial metadata of this dependency property on the class. 其他派生的类可能可以通过重写其类构造函数中的元数据的更改此默认值。Other derived classes may potentially change this default value by overriding the metadata from within their class constructor. 值不会应用于实际布局中，除非该元素也将可见 (是`true`)。The value of won't be applied to actual layout unless the element is also visible ( is `true`). 上应用了从父元素在元素树中自上而下到子元素，但嵌套的不透明度设置不单个子元素的属性值中所示的可视效果。 is applied from parent elements on down the element tree to child elements, but the visible effects of the nested opacity settings aren't indicated in the property value of individual child elements. 例如，如果列表中有 50%(0.5) 不透明度的一个列表项具有自己的不透明度设置为 20%(0.2)，该列表项的净不透明度将呈现，就好像 10%(0.1)，但属性值的列表项的属性仍将为 0.2 查询时。For instance, if a list has a 50% (0.5) opacity and one of its list items has its own opacity set to 20% (0.2), the net visible opacity for that list item will be rendered as if it were 10% (0.1), but the property value of the list item property would still be 0.2 when queried. 即使声明或计算的不透明度为 0，元素仍出现在中，输入的事件和命令，并能够获得焦点。Even if the declared or evaluated opacity is 0, an element still participates in input events and commands, and is potentially focusable. 此方面可能很有用，例如可用于不透明度为零的对象 （如形状） 屏蔽透明元素具有的基础对象。This aspect can be useful, for instance you can use an opacity-zero object (such as a shape) for masking underlying objects with transparent elements. 然后，不透明度为零的对象可以处理所有输入的事件处理基础范围。The opacity-zero object can then handle all the input event processing for an underlying area. 但是，`Background`或`Fill`对象或形状的应设置为一个值，即使它是，否则不启用命中测试，并且会接收任何事件。However, the `Background` or `Fill` of the object or shape should be set to a value, even if it is , otherwise hit testing is not enabled, and no events are received. ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None|

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Media::Brush ^ OpacityMask { System::Windows::Media::Brush ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Media::Brush ^ value); };
member this.OpacityMask : System.Windows.Media.Brush with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个作为 实现的不透明蒙板，该蒙板可应用到此元素所呈现内容的任何 Alpha 通道蒙板。

span.span: Gets or sets an opacity mask, as a implementation that is applied to any alpha-channel masking for the rendered content of this element.

summary.span: 这是依赖项属性。

span.span: This is a dependency property.

value.span: 要用于不透明蒙板的画笔。

span.span: The brush to use for opacity masking.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性仅使用 alpha 通道值是具有提供的任何。This property only uses whatever the alpha channel value is for the supplied . 其他通道的呈现内容 （红色、 绿色还是蓝色） 将被忽略。The other channels of the 's rendered content (Red, Green, or Blue) are ignored. 最典型的目的就是，可以用于各种照片蒙板虚光照等技术。The most typical for this purpose is an , which can be used for a variety of photo masking techniques such as a vignette. 但任何定义(如) 可用。But any defined (such as ) can be used. 在中[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]，此属性的值可以使用特定于的每个实现的内联语法抽象类。In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], this property value can use an inline syntax that is specific to each implementation of the abstract class. 有关详细信息，请参阅[使用纯色和渐变概述进行绘制](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/painting-with-solid-colors-and-gradients-overview.md)。For more information, see [Painting with Solid Colors and Gradients Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/painting-with-solid-colors-and-gradients-overview.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|无None| ## Examples 以下标记示例演示应用于另一个不透明蒙板。The following markup example shows an opacity mask applied to another . [!code-xaml[OpacityMasksSnippet#UIElementOpacityMask](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/OpacityMasksSnippet/CS/ImageBrushExample.xaml#uielementopacitymask)]

span.span: The unique identifier for this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 唯一地标识每个元素。 uniquely identifies each element. 某个元素范围保持不变每次相同[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]加载 （包括二进制表示形式）。An element keeps the same every time the same [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] is loaded (including binary representations). 此标识符用于内部加载、 分析和序列化要求。This identifier is used for internal loading, parsing and serialization requirements. 它不是由应用程序代码使用。It is not intended to be used by your application code. 此属性与没有任何关系对于任何给定的实例的结果。This property has no relationship to the result for any given instance.

Public Overridable Function PredictFocus (direction As FocusNavigationDirection) As DependencyObject

abstract member PredictFocus : System.Windows.Input.FocusNavigationDirection -> System.Windows.DependencyObject override this.PredictFocus : System.Windows.Input.FocusNavigationDirection -> System.Windows.DependencyObject

param.name: direction
param.span: 请求的焦点遍历的方向。

span.span: The direction of the requested focus traversal.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，返回将按指定焦点遍历方向接收焦点的元素，而不用实际将焦点移至该元素。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, returns the element that would receive focus for a specified focus traversal direction, without actually moving focus to that element.

returns.span: 如果实际调用了 ，则为接收焦点的元素。

span.span: The element that would have received focus if were actually invoked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法在此类中的默认实现不完整，并始终返回`null`。The default implementation of this method in this class is incomplete, and always returns `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 密钥处理与其他平台功能，例如命令和文本组合进行交互。Key handling interacts with other platform features such as commanding and text composition. 事件是一个较低级别的文本输入的事件，可能不会像预期某些控件上。The event is a lower-level text input event that might not behave as expected on certain controls. 这是文本的因为某些控件具有控件组合或提供更高级版本的类处理输入处理和相关的事件。This is because some controls have control compositing or class handling that provides a higher-level version of text input handling and related events. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这看上去要遵循元素树的隧道路由，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this seems to follow a tunneling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的事件数据的基础的事件数据公开事件。The event data of this event exposes the event data of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 如果将标记处理，在实质上标注处理沿路由的所有其他侦听器和所有相关的事件。If you mark handled, you are essentially marking handled for all further listeners along the route, and on all related events. 这可能包括类处理程序生成事件，如。This possibly includes class-handler generated events such as . 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly PreviewMouseLeftButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: 标识 路由事件。

span.span: Identifies the routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且移动鼠标指针时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 都会发生此事件时鼠标指针第一次进入元素边界，并还在鼠标指针移动时仍剩余元素的边界内。This event occurs both when the mouse pointer first enters into the element bounds, and also when the mouse pointer moves while still remaining within the element bounds. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 任意一个协同通常引发事件或，对应于一个两个标准鼠标按钮按下。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 并也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的特定于按钮的事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注或。See Remarks for or . ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且用户滚动鼠标滚轮时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the user rotates the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于在鼠标指针位于其中;因此，如果您收到此事件的已设定焦点或捕获的元素，将鼠标指针实际上可能是另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive this event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

summary.span: 在指针位于此元素上并且按下触笔按钮时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the stylus button is pressed while the pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 触摸、 鼠标和触笔输入中的特定关系存在。Touch, mouse, and stylus input exist in a particular relationship. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Windows Vista 中的触摸屏输入支持](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/63f1d71f-03d8-4d83-a174-e3dc7c57bad0)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Touch Input Support in Windows Vista](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/63f1d71f-03d8-4d83-a174-e3dc7c57bad0) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly PreviewStylusButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: 在此元素以设备无关模式获取文本时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许组件或应用程序以与设备无关的方式侦听文本输入。The event allows a component or application to listen for text input in a device-independent manner. 键盘是主要的方式; 但语音、 手写和其他输入的设备也可以生成。The keyboard is the primary means of ; but speech, handwriting, and other input devices can also generate . 由于键组合的默认键盘或输入的法编辑器的多个关键事件可能会引发一个文本输入的事件。Because of key combinations - either in default keyboards or through input method editors - multiple key events may raise just one text input event. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|隧道Tunneling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的浮升事件是。The corresponding bubbling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.
